comments:
N20031201

When the eclipse starter can't find some required plugins, it throws an 
BundleException that only states:
org.osgi.framework.BundleException: An error occured trying to read the bundle

The real reason was that the plugin was missing. I had to debug into the code 
to get that.
(error while reading sounds more like a corrupt data problem)

org.osgi.framework.BundleException: An error occured trying to read the bundle
	at 
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.defaultadaptor.DefaultAdaptor$1.begin
(DefaultAdaptor.java:468)
	at 
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.installWorkerPrivileged
(Framework.java:959)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework$1.run
(Framework.java:833)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.installWorker
(Framework.java:924)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.installBundle
(Framework.java:826)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContext.installBundle
(BundleContext.java:227)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.loadBundles
(EclipseStarter.java:164)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:81)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.OSGiBootLoader.basicRun
(OSGiBootLoader.java:239)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.OSGiBootLoader.run
(OSGiBootLoader.java:665)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.OSGiBootLoader.run
(OSGiBootLoader.java:652)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:298)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:765)

The message should be better since we have a resolver etc that carefully 
figures out these things.  We need to investigate and make it easier to 
understand what is going wrong.

Can you give us an idea of what sort of plugin was missing?  Was it one of 
yours (ie., source in your workspace, bin, in the target platform, ...)

I was missing org.eclipse.osgi.services_3.0.0
(which is a plugin required by nobody so the plugin importer did not add it to 
my list)

Thanks.  services is special and so we might be getting an error in a 
collateral place.  Will investigate and resolve.
The message for missing 'well known' bundles has been improved.

traces.message: An error occured trying to read the bundle
